comment.body: The image shows a search field at the ZeroHello page....how does one make this search field appear?

> [erkan](#comment_14_1H8oKiRa7fGgUqS1hpUtaSYLvAqkaknbkf): Which ZeroNet version do you have ? You need 0.3.7 rev1232 (see )

> [erkan](#comment_14_1H8oKiRa7fGgUqS1hpUtaSYLvAqkaknbkf): Which ZeroNet version do you have ?You need 0.3.7 rev1232 (see "master branch" here) for upgrading. But keep in mind master branch is always unstable, so make a backup always first

I did but no search field appears. Also the instructions do sound like they are for making sure a site appears in the list of search results. They do not sound like instructions for making a search field appear on the HelloZeroNet main page. I have 0.3.7 REV 1235 - which updates automatically for me when an update is pushed.

> [nofish](#comment_80_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj): start following a site and you will see it

Yes! I clicked follow on your blog and now Hello ZeroNet includes a search. Brilliant thank you. It would probably be better to automatically be visible and search all seeded sites at least.
